subject: Re: [junit] the humbug dialog box, was: How can I automatize a mouse click ?
msgSnippet: On Sunday, May 2, 2004, at 9:15:01 AM, Thomas L Roche  ... I resemble this remark, and it s hard to refute. I still don t have the
messageBody:
On Sunday, May 2, 2004, at 9:15:01 AM, Thomas L Roche <tlroche@...>
wrote:

> ) it was at one time legitimate to say "I can't xUnit my UI, so I will
> try to do the best I can," i.e. create a thin UI well-separated from
> its model and control. But it was *never* legitimate to make a virtue
> of necessity, to say (as you do) that "separation is the solution."
> Now that you *can* drive your UIs from JUnit, and therefore you can
> *fully* test your UIs, your claim is illegitimate, and moreover
> encourages the "anti-test-infection."

I resemble this remark, and it's hard to refute.

I still don't have the necessary skill to do very well what Thomas rightly
recommends, but I believe that he's right.

Ron Jeffries
www.XProgramming.com
Ron gave me a good suggestion once. -- Carlton (banshee858)
